document_data.mainbody: The '''Grinning Lion''' was a tavern in the [[North Ward of Waterdeep|North Ward]] of the city of [[Waterdeep]].{{Cite dungeon/126/Vampires of Waterdeep: Blood of Malar|65}}
document_data.Location: [[File:North Ward-Gost Villa.png|thumb|right|270px|''Map showing the location of the Grinning Lion (labeled N56) ''circa'' 1372 DR.'']] The tavern was located inside a commercial and residential block just off [[Golden Serpent Street]], near the east side of the corner with [[Shando Street]]. It was just across the alley from the rear of the [[Gost Villa]].

Structure.Stairs of the Lion:
Behind the establishment was a refuse dump of rotting food and trash that was regularly reduced in size by the [[Dungsweepers' Guild|trash collectors]], but it never seemed to get completely removed. Unger Farshal arranged it this way because the smelly mound hid a wooden board that covered a stone staircase that led down {{SI|20|ft|long=yes}}{{Cite dungeon/126/Vampires of Waterdeep: Blood of Malar|70}}

A secret door on the south wall was added by Farshal so he or [[Orlpar Husteem|his client]] could easily get to a [[Waterdeep/Sewers#Surface Shafts & Junction Rooms|junction room]] of the city sewers for clandestine travel or a quick escape. A second secret door, known only to Farshal and the denizen of its destination, was built around the {{YearlinkName|1219}}, by the [[Gost]] family to facilitate their smuggling operations in and out of Waterdeep.{{Cite dungeon/128/Vampires of Waterdeep: The Fireplace Level|73}} The bottom three steps of the Stairs of the Lion opened as a trap door to steps leading down to the west and eventually to the [[Fireplace Level]], a complex of storerooms that was eventually abandoned and forgotten by the Gosts.{{Cite dungeon/128/Vampires of Waterdeep: The Fireplace Level|74}}

document_data.Services: The tavern served fried [[onion]]s, [[eel]]s, pitchers of [[wine]], and [[zzar]].
document_data.History: The Grinning Lion was built on the site of a former warehouse owned by the Gost family back in the 13{{th}} century DR.
document_data.Inhabitants:
The proprietor of the Lion was [[Unger Farshal]] from at least [[1367 DR]] to at least 1372 DR. Both male and female dancers performed to the music in mock armor. Most patrons were nobles accompanied by their personal bodyguards.

Patrons that frequented this establishment included:
* Lord [[Orlpar Husteem]], aristocratic drug dealer.
* [[Hala Myrt]], runner and go-between for Orlpar.
